image.altText: Childrens toys including a giraffe inside a car and an abacus.

props.synopsis: Victoria's childcare regulators are failing to keep kids safe due to poor information sharing, legal constraint, chronic underfunding and a system that places the privacy of educators and the pursuit of profits over child safety, a rapid review has found.

title.children: Victoria urged to overhaul childcare safety after damning rapid review

image.altText: A woman walks near a police van in front of police tape.

props.synopsis: A Victorian man is charged with murder following the death of a 32-year-old woman in Cobram on Tuesday. Â

title.children: Police charge man with murder following death of woman in Cobram

image.altText: Signage is seen for Monash IVF in Clayton, Melbourne.

props.synopsis: The review was launched following unrelated cases of embryo mix-ups in Brisbane and Melbourne, which were reported this year

title.children: Review into Monash IVF embryo mix-ups to remain secret

image.altText: A woman is standing up looking at a laptop.

props.synopsis: Former childcare workers at a centre where a man is alleged to have sexually assaulted two children speak out about a culture of secrecy in the centres.

title.children: Goodstart workers 'disgusted' with childcare complaints handling in abuse case

image.altText: A pile of bricks and rubbish between a fence and a shed.

props.synopsis: After relying on a buyer's agent for expert advice, a "blindsided" Sydney couple discovers their investment property has costly hidden problems.

title.children: Investors issue warning on buyer's agents after costly property blunder

image.altText: The outside of a premises with a blue banner reading "health clinic and pharmacy" "cohealth"

props.synopsis: This community health organisation is having to cancel appointments when it rains, as the roof leaks, making rooms uninhabitable.Â

title.children: Poor infrastructure forcing community health appointment cancellations

image.altText: a group of pro-palestine protesters

props.synopsis: City of Melbourne councillors have voted for an amendment that will see the municipality advocate to reduce disruption caused by protests to businesses, in a proposal that will now go to community consultation.

title.children: City of Melbourne councillors vote for review of protest management

image.altText: A piece of slow-cooked lamb in a pot alongside lemon, fennel, potatoes and juices, topped with fresh green herbs.

props.synopsis: The cost of a lamb leg in the shops has nearly doubled in the past 18 months as the drought bites.

title.children: Traditional lamb roast out of reach for many families as prices double

image.altText: Fatima Payman

props.synopsis: In a statement to a Victorian court, WA Senator Fatima Payman said the abusive emails left her "deeply unsettled" and afraid to travel to the state.

title.children: Bail for man who sent vile death threat to senator

image.altText: A bald man sits on a beach outside a courthouse holding his phone to his ear.

props.synopsis: A County Court of Victoria jury finds Huvasi Cayli guilty of defrauding the Australian Taxation Office of $87,000 through GST refund claims.

title.children: Jury finds Victorian business owner guilty of $87k tax scam

image.altText: a man with brown hair and glasses in a blue checked shirt

props.synopsis: Artificial eye maker Jack McDonald has been ordered to stop operating while the Health Complaints Commissioner in Victoria continues an investigation into him.

title.children: Artificial eye maker ordered to stop working while investigation underway

image.altText: The exterior of the Supreme Court of Victoria.

props.synopsis: A Victorian government department wants to keep secret how it manages the life of a vulnerable teenage girl, who remains locked up after stabbing a woman to death in 2023.

title.children: Department that 'failed' teenage killer makes secrecy bid over her ongoing care

image.altText: The facade of a real estate agency building sits on a streetscape.

props.synopsis: A Victorian real estate agency escapes a hefty fine and conviction after an "honest" mistake resulted in a rental property being listed without a fixed price.

title.children: Agency escapes fine for 'honest' mistake when pricing rental property

image.altText: Police car with street blocked by police tape.

props.synopsis: Police found the 32-year-old woman's body about 5am this morning.

title.children: Man arrested after woman found dead in Cobram home

image.altText: Police officers stand around a police cars parked on the road outside a BP service station that is taped off with police tape.

props.synopsis: Paramedics tried to save the man but he died on a footpath in Melbourne's south-east.

title.children: Man dies outside service station after stabbing in Dandenong

image.altText: Caucasian-looking man smiles, wears yellow, blue tee, blue pants, cap with L2P, holds rag, under car hood, in industrial garage.

props.synopsis: Gavin 'Bear' Hyman lost his young son in an accident. After years of grief, Mr Hynam began channelling his passion for mentoring young people in the local community by fixing pre-loved cars and gifting them.

title.children: Man fixes cars to gift disadvantaged drivers in memory of his son

image.altText: A woman sitting in a child holding her phone.

props.synopsis: A regional Victorian childcare worker is facing allegations of sexually assaulting two children and grooming a child in out-of-home care, an ABC investigation reveals.

title.children: Childcare worker accused of sexually assaulting children during nappy changes

image.altText: An entrance to a building

props.synopsis: A staffer at the Endeavour Hills Specialist School is charged with child sexual abuse offences, according to a letter sent to parents.

title.children: Staff member at Melbourne special school charged with child sex abuse

props.synopsis: Moana Hope details the "vile and disgusting" verbal abuse she was on the receiving end of at a local football game over the weekend.

title.children: Former AFLW star details 'vile and disgusting' abuse at local footy game

image.altText: Group of tradesmen

props.synopsis: A former Victorian property developer turns his hand towards creating housing for the homeless, warning the crisis is stifling productivity and services.

title.children: Calls for private sector help in a housing crisis 'too big for government'

image.altText: Brayden Maynard grapples with Izak Rankine

props.synopsis: Collingwood vice-captain Brayden Maynard says homophobic slurs have "happened too often" as the league investigates an alleged remark made by Izak Rankine against the Magpies.

title.children: Pies star says AFL must 'stamp out' homophobic slurs amid Rankine probe

image.altText: Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera celebrates a goal

props.synopsis: Nasiah Wanganeen-Milera gives St Kilda a major boost heading into the off-season, knocking back rival clubs to sign a two-year extension to remain in Moorabbin.

title.children: Wanganeen-Milera rejects rivals to sign monster Saints extension

image.altText: A horse lying in a tank with rescuers looking in.

props.synopsis: Australia's patchwork of emergency service capabilities differs from state to state. In Victoria, only two CFA brigades have specialised large animal rescue units and they're travelling long distances to save lives.

title.children: Victorian firefighters who save big animals send their own cry for help

image.altText: A double storey brown and cream brick home behind a brown brick fence with a black wrought iron gate on a cloudy day.

props.synopsis: A man and two teenagers have been charged after a husband, wife and grandparents were hurt during an alleged confrontation inside the Melbourne home.Â

title.children: Charges after father stabbed 11 times in alleged Kew East home invasion

image.altText: A red Ferrari car with a black and white stripe down the centre of the bonnet parked beside a black car.

props.synopsis: Over three hours the burglar stole the Ferrari and three other luxury vehicles from a home in Melbourne's inner east.

title.children: Thief steals million-dollar Ferrari as family sleeps

image.altText: A photo of a man wearing a grey cap and and grey tank tap, looking out the window.

props.synopsis: A Victorian man has no memory of a terrifying crash that left him with extensive injuries, but 18 months on he is still dealing with the complications and unable to work.

title.children: Motorcyclist was just 5 minutes from home when tragedy struck

image.altText: Western United player Riku Danzaki controls the ball while a teammate looks on

props.synopsis: Western United has less than three days to save its club after being granted an extension to appeal the decision to strip its A-Leagues licence.

title.children: Western United given extension to appeal stripping of A-Leagues licence

image.altText: Michelle Rowland mid-speech while wearing a black blazer in front of a blue backdrop

props.synopsis: Reports of children being abused in childcare have sent politicians and policymakers into overdrive, searching for solutions. A big question remains: Do we need to be brave enough to start again?

title.children: The big question facing the government on childcare safety reform

image.altText: Passengers line up for security screening at the airport.

props.synopsis: International travel has been in the spotlight recently, with nerve-wracking tales of border crackdowns in the US and unexpected detentions. Here's what your passport reveals about you when you're travelling.

title.children: Think your passport is just ID? Here's what border officials really know about you

image.altText: Zoe Besanko celebrates a goal with a St Kilda AFLW teammate.

props.synopsis: Zoe Besanko starts hot for St Kilda in an upset win over Adelaide, while Hawthorn gets some revenge for last season's AFLW finals loss to the Lions.

title.children: 'Ready to make their mark': Young stars shine as AFLW round one wraps up

image.altText: Power lines

props.synopsis: An energy expert says the $7.9 billion Victorian Transmission Plan could cost three times as much as the government is saying.

title.children: Victorian government accused of 'sleight of hand' over renewable energy cost

image.altText: A elderly woman seated and holding a black and white photography of a young lady in roller skating shoes.

props.synopsis: In 1977, the ABC interviewed a 21-year-old rollerskater during a police crackdown on public nuisance, in a video that has since gone viral. Five decades later, we've tracked her down â and she still skates.

title.children: Jean relives the days she turned heads on Melbourne streets in the 1970s

image.altText: An Indian man wearing a green shirt with his left arm in a sling, sitting on a grey couch.

props.synopsis: Saurabh Anand feared he may have to leave Australia after a shocking machete attack saw him nearly lose his hand. However, the government has granted him a visa on compassionate grounds.

title.children: Victim of 'cowardly' alleged attack granted fresh Australian visa

image.altText: A crane lowers a modular building.

props.synopsis: From early colonial settlers to the post-war construction boom, prefabricated and modular housing has a long history in Australia. Can factory-built homes fix our housing woes and help the climate?

title.children: Redefining the donga could solve more than one of Australia's housing problems

image.altText: A man in black glasses with a goatee looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: After a 60-year love affair with quilting, Yvonne Line was forced to close the sewing kit when her memory failed, but her brother has preserved her work.

title.children: Man honours sister's quilting lifework cut short by Alzheimer's disease
